intro: Heckeria umbellata, commonly known as the umbrella hecker, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and dense, compact appearance. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that resemble an umbrella, giving it its common name. Its leaves are narrow, grass-like, and often have a bluish-green hue. Heckeria umbellata is typically found in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to the cool, moist climate of its native habitat.
